result.execSummary:
The defendant Tristain J. Louis-Saffold was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Straight time.  No good time credit to be earned.
Probation can be discharged/terminated by the probation agent after 30 months if the probation sentence has been successfully served.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid before costs/fees/assessments and surcharges.
$300.00 to Michael T. and $165.00 to Jamie S.  Both amounts joint and several with defendants in cases 15CF001810 and 15CF001815,  during term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample if not already done so.
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge during term of probation.  To be paid after restitution has been satifised.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Obtain GED/HSED.  Full time employment or part time employment and school or full time school.

No Contact Order with victims Michael T. and/or Jamie S.
No Contact Order with coactors Darius Kinney and/or Harvey Kinney and/or Justina Nunely and/or Shairnee Carson.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment.
**4/8/2016  Firearm restriction was given by Honorable William Brash at the plea hearing on October 15, 2015.

records.addlTxt: Per Court entry of 4/8/2016 now showing firearm restriction.

COURT ENTRY MADE WITHOUT CASE FILE IN COURT:

Deputy clerk was notified that there is no record in the court entries regarding whether the defendant was given the firearms restriction.
Deputy clerk contacted the court reporter of record on the plea hearing of October 15, 2015 requesting she check the transcript.

On this date, the court reporter contacted the deputy clerk to inform that defendant was given the firearm restriction by Hon. William Brash at the plea hearing.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Tristain J. Louis-Saffold in court with Attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Tristain J. Louis-Saffold in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense counsel, Jacqueline S., and defendant.

-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $300
-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $165

As to Count 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve  12 months in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT time; credit for  15 days served. No good time credit to be earned.

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  36  MONTHS with the following conditions:
-  Probation can be discharged/terminated by the probation agent after 30 months if the probation sentence has been successfully served.
-  Serve 45 days in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT time.
-  AODA assessment and comply with any treatment
-  Obtain GED/HSD
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with victims Michael T.    AND/OR    Jamie S.
-  No Contact Order with co-actors  Darius Kinney  AND/OR   Harvey Kinney   AND/OR  Justina Nunely    AND/OR   Shairnee Carson
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $300 to Michael T., joint and several with the defendants in Case# 15CF001810 and # 15CF001815 during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil  judgment.
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $165 to Jamie S., joint and several with the defendants in Case# 15CF001810 and # 15CF001815 during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of probation.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tristain J. Louis-Saffold in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Sanders presiding in Branch 28 in room 629 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tristain J. Louis-Saffold in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to the amended charge.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on the amended charge as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Tristain J. Louis-Saffold in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Original Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Amended Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Co-Defendant Darius Kinney; Shairnee C; Harvey K; Justina N. Karisa C; Tomasena L. Michael T; Jamie S: 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tristain J. Louis-Saffold in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Tristain J. Louis-Saffold in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
